intro: Listrostachys muscicola, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including pink, purple, and white, and it is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Listrostachys muscicola is also known for its ability to thrive in humid environments with well-draining soil.
